## Implementation Steps

2. Modify the component to accept and display the selected variant name
3. Update the state management to track the currently selected variant
4. Style the variant name label to be visually connected to the Contact Us button

- The variant name should appear in a subtle but visible style next to the Contact Us button
- Format: "Selected: [Variant Name]" or simply "[Variant Name]"
- When changing variants, the text should update immediately

- Ensure proper color contrast for the variant label text
- Consider adding an aria-label to improve screen reader experience

subtasks.title: Fix Variant Data Rendering in Product Detail Pages
subtasks.description: Address the mismatch between variant data structure in the product catalog and how it's accessed in components. Ensure that variant information is properly displayed on product pages.
subtasks.details:
## Issue

The variant data in the product catalog uses properties like `variantId` and `variantName`, but components like `ContactButtonWithVariant` expect properties named `id` and `name`. This mismatch causes variant data not to render correctly.

## Implementation Steps

1. Examine all product detail page components that use variant data
2. Update the components to use the correct property names (`variantId` instead of `id`, `variantName` instead of `name`), or
3. Create adapters/mappers that transform the variant data to match the expected format
4. Ensure consistent property naming in new components
5. Update type definitions to reflect the actual data structure
6. Test variant selection and display on all product detail pages

## Expected Outcome
- Variant data correctly displays in all components
- Selected variant names appear next to Contact Us buttons
- Consistent property naming across the application

subtasks.title: Fix Product Detail Page Rendering for Director Series Products
subtasks.description: Resolve issues with the product detail page not rendering correctly for specific products like ashley-director-chair in the Director Series.
subtasks.details:
## Issue

The product detail page at `/chairs/director-series/ashley-director-chair` is not rendering correctly. This could be due to missing dynamic route handlers, incorrect data access, or component rendering issues.

## Implementation Steps

1. Confirm that a dynamic route handler exists at `app/chairs/[seriesId]/[productId]/page.tsx`
2. If missing, implement the dynamic route handler to parse URL parameters and fetch the correct product
3. Verify that the product data is being correctly accessed from the director-series data structure
4. Debug any rendering issues in the product detail component
5. Ensure proper error handling for cases where products don't exist
6. Test with multiple products from the series to confirm consistent rendering

## Expected Outcome
- The product detail page renders correctly for all products in the Director Series
- All product information including variants, specifications, and images displays properly
- Navigation between the series page and product detail pages works seamlessly

tasks.title: Update Product Category Type System for Specialized Furniture Categories
tasks.description: Extend our standardized product category type system to include 'hospital-furniture', 'racking-systems', 'school-furniture', 'storage-solutions', 'modular-furniture', and 'office-accessories' and ensure consistency throughout the application
tasks.details:
## Current Issue

The application is using specialized furniture categories ('hospital-furniture', 'racking-systems', and 'school-furniture') in their respective routes, but these categories are not included in our standardized ProductCategorySlug type. This causes type errors when calling API functions that expect a valid ProductCategorySlug.

## Implementation Steps

1. Update the ProductCategorySlug type in types/product-categories.ts and types/product-categories-unified.ts to include all specialized furniture categories
2. Add appropriate display name mappings for the new categories
3. Update category lists in components where all categories are enumerated
4. Ensure all imports use the updated type definitions
5. Update tests to include the new categories

## Success Criteria

- No type errors in the specialized furniture category routes
- Consistent usage of the new categories across the application
- All components and pages that handle product categories work correctly with the new categories
- Documentation updated to reflect the additions

observations.title: Implementing ContactButtonWithVariant Component
observations.description: The ContactButtonWithVariant component has been implemented in the components/products directory. It handles displaying the selected variant name next to the Contact Us button and includes proper accessibility attributes.
observations.content:
## Component Implementation Details

The `ContactButtonWithVariant` component has been implemented with the following features:

1. **Responsive Layout**:
   - Stack layout on mobile (button above variant name)
   - Horizontal layout on larger screens (button beside variant name)

2. **Accessibility Features**:
   - `aria-label` on the button that includes the variant name when selected
   - `aria-live="polite"` on the variant text to announce changes to screen readers

3. **Styling**:
   - Muted text color for the variant name
   - Consistent spacing and alignment
   - Full-width button on mobile, auto-width on larger screens

4. **State Handling**:
   - Conditionally renders the variant name only when a variant is selected
   - Accepts a null selectedVariant for when no variant is chosen

## Usage Example

To use this component in a product detail page:

```tsx
<ContactButtonWithVariant
  selectedVariant={currentlySelectedVariant}
  onContactClick={handleContactFormOpen}
  className="mt-6"
/>
```

Where `currentlySelectedVariant` is a state variable that updates when the user selects different product options.

## Next Steps

1. Update product detail pages to use this component
2. Ensure the variant selection state is properly passed to this component
3. Connect the contact form to include the selected variant information

observations.title: Implemented Dynamic Product Detail Page Routes
observations.description: Created a dynamic route handler to properly render product detail pages like /chairs/director-series/ashley-director-chair.
observations.content:
## Implementation Details

1. **Dynamic Route Handler**:
   - Created a dynamic route handler at `app/chairs/[seriesId]/[productId]/page.tsx`
   - Implemented proper data fetching and error handling
   - Added metadata generation for SEO

2. **Centralized Product Fetching**:
   - Created utility functions in `lib/utils/product-utils.ts`
   - Implemented functions to get products and series by ID
   - Designed for future extensibility to other categories

3. **Product Detail Component**:
   - Implemented a robust `ProductDetailPage` component
   - Added support for product variants with proper TypeScript typing
   - Created a responsive layout with image gallery and specifications
   - Integrated the `ContactButtonWithVariant` component

4. **Error Handling**:
   - Added a custom not-found page
   - Implemented proper error checks for missing products
   - Added informative messages to guide users

## Benefits

- **Consistent Interface**: All product detail pages now use the same component structure
- **Improved Type Safety**: Added TypeScript interfaces that match our data structure
- **Better UX**: Users see proper error pages instead of broken content
- **Maintainable Code**: Centralized data fetching reduces duplication

## Next Steps

- Extend the implementation to handle other product categories and series
- Optimize image loading with responsive Cloudinary transformations
- Add breadcrumb navigation for better user orientation
- Implement related products section at the bottom of detail pages

observations.content:

1. **Product Data Structure**:
   - Added product data to /data/products/chairs/director-series.ts
   - Created product entry with slug 'woodland-director-chair'
   - Added variant definitions (HB, MB variants)

2. **Image Integration**:
   - Added Cloudinary image mappings in product-images.ts
   - Followed folder structure: steelmade/chairs/director-series/woodland/
   - Created variant-specific image mappings (ic-338-hb.jpg)

3. **Route Configuration**:
   - Utilized dynamic route /chairs/director-series/[productId]
   - Product slug matches data structure
   - Page component fetches data correctly

4. **Key Requirements**:
   - Consistent product slug between route and data
   - Correct Cloudinary folder structure
   - Proper variant definitions
   - Image name format following convention (ic-XXX-[variant].jpg)
   - Navigation data updates

## Missing Elements for Opera Chair:
   - Product data entry in director-series.ts
   - Variant definitions for HB (ic-340-hb) and MB (ic-341-mb)
   - Image mappings in Cloudinary config
   - Navigation data update

## Next Steps for Opera Chair:
1. Add product data with proper slug 'opera-director-chair'
2. Define variants matching image names
3. Add Cloudinary image mappings
4. Update navigation data
5. Verify route configuration

observations.title: Director Series Chair Implementation Pattern
observations.details:
Successfully implemented Opera and Tycoon Director Chairs following our established pattern:

1. **Data Structure**:
   - Added to director-series.ts
   - Consistent product slug format (opera-director-chair, tycoon-director-chair)
   - Standard variant structure (HB/MB variants)
   - Complete metadata and specifications

2. **Image Integration**:
   - Opera: ic-340-hb.jpg, ic-341-mb.jpg
   - Tycoon: ic-01-hb.jpg, ic-02-mb.jpg
   - Proper Cloudinary paths in steelmade/chairs/director-series/[product]

3. **Route Configuration**:
   - Dynamic routing working correctly
   - Proper data flow from director series to product pages
   - Navigation and breadcrumbs updated

This implementation confirms our product data structure is robust and reusable across different chair models.
